result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen T Hink was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: each other and SAR cases

superMiscConds.notes: FTE/School or combintaion of the two, and if not fully engaged and complete 10 hours community service per week.

Complete SAFE program.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: each other and SAR cases

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime work or fulltime school and when not fully engaged, complete 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with H.H. unless approved by agent.

Complete SAFE Program.
Attend counseling and programming recommended by agent.
10 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Becky.
Case called: 9:16 am
INCLUDES 13CM2180, 14CM400, 15CM851 & 15CM2417
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Def appears in custody w/Atty Pauline Toulouse;  

***PLEA HEARING in 15CM2417***
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed; VRCW;
PLEA: 
Ct 1 (DC/Repeater)>GUILTY
Ct 2 (Intentionally Contact-Order for Misd Conviction/Repeater)>GUILTY
Ct 3 (BJ-Misd/Repeater)>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty. 

***MOTION TO REVOKE DEJ in 15CM851***
State moves for entry of judgment in Ct. 1; COURT grants and finds defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 15CM851 (Ct1) & 15CM2417> 2 years prison (1 yr IC/1 yr ES) to run CONCURRENT and CONCURRENT to SAR cases; CONDITIONS: Complete SAFE intake program or equivalent; Maintain Absolute sobriety; Assessments/Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; FTW/school or combination of two, and if not so fuly engaged, complete 10 hrs CS per week; No contact with H.H. unless approved by agent; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.
COURT notes deft has 13 days credit in 15CM851 & 41 days credit on 15CM2417

***SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION in 14CM400 & 13CM2180***

COURT ORDERS: 15CM400 Ct 2>90 days MCJ; 15CM400 Ct 3 > 9 months MCJ; 13CM2180 Ct 1> 9 months MCJ
COURT notes deft has 90 days credit in 14CM400 Ct 1; 170 days credit in 14CM400 Ct 3; 170 days credit in 13CM2180
COURT converts court costs to civil judgment.

Adj: 9:32 am
to Revoke Deferred Entry of Judgment of Count One - stj
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 10:51am
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner;  Defendent appears in person with Atty Amanda Ley

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
State moves to file an amended complaint 
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 Disorderly Conduct- Repeater-Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct-Repeater >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: Ct 1. -COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 12 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct.1
Ct. 2 - Sentencing withheld. 1  year probabtion. CONDITIONS: Complete SAFE program, attend counseling and programming recommended by agent, maintain full time work or full time school and when not fully engaged, complete 10 hours community service per week. No contact with H.H. unless approved by agent. 10 days credit granted

DEOJ review date: 09/28/16 at 1:10pm

Parties make argument to bond
COURT modifies bond; defendent may have contact with H.H. 
Bond continues

Adj: 11:00am

MINUTES AMENDED 10/02/15 at 12:05am
Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2015 at 09:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Stephen T Hink
Current: 5507 Rose St., Weston, WI 54476 United States  (Effective: 05-18-2015)
Prior: 2345 Grand Avenue #8, Wausau, WI 54403

Pre-trial conference on June 26, 2015 at 09:10 am.
Final pre-trial on August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury Trial on September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No contact with victim(s):  H.H. (non-waivable).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.
